alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:28AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northern Cheyenne, northern Rawlins and northern Decatur Counties in northwestern Kansas, southwestern Red Willow, southern Hitchcock and southern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 115 AM MDT/215 AM CDT/... At 1228 AM MDT/128 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Herndon to 11 miles north of McDonald. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oberlin, Atwood and Ludell. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 235 and 253. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
